translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with Mandāravapuppha as the Foremost
“At that time I was a master of the three knowledges
on the Himalayas, the mountain of snow.
I saw the Buddha, free from defilements,
walking for alms, of great worth.
into a topknot on my head,
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
… the Buddha’s instruction has been accomplished.” 🔽Thus the elder Kesarapupphiya recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kesarapupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Kesarapupphiyattherassāpadānaṁ catutthaṁ.
